page.title: 05PLACE NAMES
page.content:
Most of the place names in Orkney were first used by Norwegian settlers and their descendants in Orkney.The spelling of these place-names may vary but their local pronunciation will have changed very little.These place names all have a meaning as the examples below show.
{WEST THRAVE}_ Thrave meaning rich fertile land. {SCAR}_ House built on soft rock. {NEIGARTH}_ Nei being norse for new and Garth meaning farm. {BRECKAN}_ Breck means slope,so Breckan simply means house on a slope. {STANGASETTER}_ Stanga is a Norse christian name,and setter is also Norse meaning Hill Pasture. {SAND BACK}_ Sandy bank.
